entry.title: Shiver Entertainment (Nintendo)
entry.subtitle: Optimization Specialist Engineer
entry.description: Used as a trusted contractor by several AAA studios, Shiver Entertainment is one of the foremost experts in optimizing software to run on lower powered systems (particularly the Nintendo Switch). Despite having been acquired by Nintendo, Shiver is perhaps most commonly known for their close working relationship with Warner Brothers Games and subsidiaries, with several major titles having their Switch ports done by Shiver.

entry.title: Virtel
entry.subtitle: Virtual Reality Language Learning
entry.description: Virtel was a small team working to create software for foreign language education in Virtual Reality. Although now defunct, the startup was at one point poised to publish an initial package of Latin American Spanish learning environments and activities.

entry.title: H3VR Gun Game
entry.subtitle: Now with a statistically unlikely chance of giving you bad results!
entry.description: H3VR is the single largest and best engineered Gun simulator in VR. Based on its extensive modding support, Gun Game brings the classic game mode from Call of Duty into H3. Originally developed by KacperObara, I developed several improvements that I had wanted included in the mod, which were then merged back in to main.

entry.title: Capstone Project
entry.subtitle: Self Aligning Free Space Optics
entry.description: My Capstone project team was contracted by Raytheon to design and develop a system that would allow for easy self-alignment of a Free Space Optics (FSO) systems. By using Computer Vision and an Arduino micro controller we were able to create a system that could identify and pivot towards a target at distances of up to one Kilometer.

entry.title: Food Wheel
entry.subtitle: All your Friends are Unhelpful
entry.description: This is a really simple page that uses your location data to pull a list of local restaurants and select one at random. There is a bit of customization if you want to limit some options, but it's very rudimentary. Perfect when nobody will agree on anything, because it will easily prove that your group can agree on what everybody DOESN'T want.
